result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Ahrndt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of $500 fine + costs + Domestic Abuse Surcharge + DNA Surcharge= Payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid Rx. No entrance into any bars, taverns or liquor store whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol with the exception of entering to pay for golf green fees or fishing tournament fees. Absolute Sobriety.

Maintain/obtain full time employment. Any assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Must take all medications prescribed and only as prescribed. Maintain and obtain any treatment for mental health. Compliance with all domestic abuse injunctions that have been put in place. DNA Sample Due no later than 4 pm on July 29, 2022. Payment of restitution if claim is made.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian J. Ahrndt

records.addlTxt:
8:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Robert James Mraz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian J. Ahrndt in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Brian J. Ahrndt. 
Court calls case. 
Atty provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty agrees.
Victim rights compliance.
ADA reads charge on Count 1. 
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters No Contest Plea.
Non-citizen advisory.
Deft inquires on ability to golf and participate in fishing tournaments due to the condition of probation that prohibits deft from entering any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
ADA has no objections to deft paying for green fees or fishing tournament fees in the bar. 
Court advises deft that does not allow for lingering in those types of establishments. 
Deft understands. 
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty on Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2. 
ADA heard on sentencing.
Court reviews Victim Impact Statement.
Court provides deft with Victim Impact Statement- reviews with atty. 
Atty heard on sentencing.
Court heard on factors.
Court impose and stayed: 90 days jail time and places deft on probation for 1 year. 
Conditions of probation: 
Payment of restitution if claim is made. 
Payment of $500 fine + costs + Domestic Abuse Surcharge + DNA Surcharge= Payment to be worked out with agent. 
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substance without a valid Rx. 
Absolute sobriety. 
No entrance into any bars, taverns, or liquor stores whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- with the exception of entering to pay for golf green fees or fishing tournament fees.
Maintain/obtain full time employment. 
Any assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. 
Must take all medications prescribed and only as prescribed.  
Maintain and obtain any treatment for mental health. 
Compliance with all Domestic Abuse injunctions that have been put in place. 
DNA Sample Due: No later than 4pm in July 29, 2022. 
Appeal rights. 
9:02 AM

10:01 AM Prosecuting attorney robert James mraz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian J. Ahrndt in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Brian J. Ahrndt. 
Court calls case. 
Atty spks- requests moment to spk with Deft. 
Off record: 10:01 AM
On record: 10:02 AM
Atty spks- requests STC in a week to allow deft time to think about offer. 
ADA responds- would like to know if it will be scheduled for a plea/sent to allow time to give notice to victim. 
Atty responds- it is the deft's intention to move forward with plea/sent at next hearing.
Court schedules with parties. 
10:06 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:01  AM Prosecuting Attorney Robert James Mraz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian J. Ahrndt in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Brian J. Ahrndt. 
Court calls case. 
Court swears in Deft and reviews Dean Atty paperwork. 
Deft agrees.
Atty spks- has not received discovery or an offer.
Demand for Discovery was filed on March 30,2022. 
Requests STC.
ADA spks on entering a plea.
Court reviews prior proceedings-Deft has not entered a plea.
Atty has reviewed complaint with Deft.
Enters NG plea.
Court schedules with parties. 
11:04 AM
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Letter from JA to Deft; RE: Order on petition for appt of an atty

08:41 AM Defendant Brian J. Ahrndt in court.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case. 
Atty Spansail is in the courtroom and spks- deft does not qualify for a Public Defender and provided Dean PW to deft. 
Copy of complaint. 
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties. 
Court spks- deft to complete Dean paperwork and bring to Clerk of Courts office. 
Court inquires on payment plan.
Deft responds. 
DA spks on bond recommendations. 
Court imposes $1,000 signature bond with conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances  without a valid Rx and no violent contact with K. L. 
Court schedules with parties. 
8:46 AM
  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
